oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Interview - Peter Guralnick - 2005-11-12
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Interview with author Peter Guralnick about his biography on Sam Cooke titled Dream Boogie: The Triumph of Sam Cooke from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on November 12, 2005.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Peter Guralnick; Jay Orr;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Includes questions from the audience. Recording begins in progress / (00:00) Opening comments by Jay Orr / (00:37) Introduction of Peter / (01:17) Peter talks about his inspiration for writing his Sam Cooke biography and reads segments from his book / (16:28) Peter talks about continuity from previous book research to this book / (19:52) Comments about Elvis Presley and Sam Cooke / (21:31) Talks about Sam Cooke, Nashville, Gorgeous George and Jimi Hendrix / (24:23) Talks about Sam making the transition from gospel music to secular music and the effect of Ray Charles' recording of I Got A Woman on music / (29:00) Influence of behind the scenes people like Art Rupe, Bumps Blackwell and Barbara Cooke on Sam and music and the attempt to present and honest picture of Sam / (33:41) Answers question from the audience regarding Allen Klein in regards to Sam and removing preconceptions from his writing /

(37:10) Answers question from audience regarding Sam's social life and the manner or his death / record signal break / (42:07) Peter talks about meeting and interviewing Barbara Cooke and his thoughts about her / (45:14) Peter talks about his feelings about Sam Cooke, his songwriting and his music / (48:15) Answers question from audience regarding Sam's early song writing and Sam working with René Hall / (53:12) Answers question about Sam and Bobby Womack and the Womack brothers / (55:08) Answers question about Sam working with Billie Holiday / (57:39) Answers questions about Sam reaching out to white audiences while never losing the black audience and his trying to conquer that divide / (01:01:24) Question about Elvis Presley, his instincts and the civil rights movement / PROGRAM ENDS ABRUPTLY /
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Guralnick, Peter; Orr, Jay; Cooke, Sam; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
